page.title: 12Darwen_Trading & Transport
page.content: The town centre is called the Circus and has several markets and a trading and transport boulevard.The transport centre has an information bureau and the area is used for buses to all parts of town and outside.The markets cover part of the semi-circle of the Circus.They have a carpark above them and a cafe and bread shop close by.Trading and transport are close together here.Branching out from behind the markets is the union street complex of social service buildings, St.Peters church several supermarkets and outlying trading streets one of which has just been made into a pedestrian walkway.The main roads go out to Bolton and Blackburn,other side roads go to the sides of the valley sides,over to Hoddlesden and the other to sunnyhurst on the way to jubilee tower.
